c74object.name: j.out~
c74object.description: j.out~ is an output conduit for audio signals in a Jamoma model (much like j.out is for control signals). It allows to turn on or off audio signal sent from the model or bypass audio signal processing in the model when used in combination with j.in~.
c74object.discussion:
When the model's 'amenities attribute is set to all or audio, j.out~ automatically creates a few nodes under the containing model namespace so its features can be remotely addressed. Hence it creates an audio/mute node under the Jamoma model it is created in so that audio signal sent from the model can be muted. When used in combination with j.in~, it also creates an audio/bypass node so that audio signal sent to the model can be muted from j.in~ outlet and directly sent to paired j.out~. It also creates an audio/out.<argument> so that audio signal sent from the model can be received remotely (ie.using j.receive~).
When j.in~/out~ features are excluded from amenities (ie. @amenities none), these nodes are removed from the namespace and the services are disabled

objarg.name: instance name
objarg.digest: Instance name to subscribe input in Jamoma namespace
objarg.description: An argument set to j.out~ sets a instance name to subscribe output in Jamoma namespace. The full address of this node will be <model name>/audio/in.<argument>

method.name: anything
method.digest: Signal to send from the model
method.description: When the audio/mute parameter is set to 0 (default), signal sent to j.out~ inlet gets output at its outlet so it can be sent out of your model. When a j.in~ object sharing the same instance name defined as argument is placed within the model and the internal parameter audio/bypass is set to 1 (default = 0), signal is directly received from paired j.in~ without passing through the whol audio chain in your model

method.name: dump
method.description: The dump message outputs all attributes value out of j.out~ rightmost outlet

method.name: signal
method.digest: Audio signal to send out of the model
method.description: Audio signal to send out of the model

attribute.name: gain
attribute.description: The gain attribute sets the output gain level of your model. This attribute is internally mapped with the audio/gain parameter of your model

attribute.name: mix
attribute.description: The mix attribute sets a balance between audio signal coming at paired j.in~ inlet and at j.out~ inlet. This attribute is internally mapped to your model audio/mix parameter

attribute.name: mute
attribute.description: The mute attribute toggles on or off audio output. This attribute is internally linked to the audio/mute model parameter

attribute.name: type
attribute.digest: Set the type of the output
attribute.description: The type attribute sets the type of the output (default = audio)
